ProjectTitle: Esilience and SOlidarity in intercultural encounters between displaced migrants and host society members: An ego-centered NETwork approach
InitialFeedbackHistory:
19/07/2022
3. Legal-ethical
Since you are interviewing people, you are processing personal information / data. I assume you will submit a PRET application for carrying out the interviews (https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/index). That will be your legal registration for processing such personal data. 

6. Data preservation
Will audio recordings of interviews also be preserved? As these classify as personal data under GDPR. After transcription you could destroy audio recordings. 

7. Data sharing
You can use KU Leuven RDR (research data repository) with access restrictions, to facilitate future reuse of data: https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/index. 
Include permission for future reuse of interviews in informed consent.
label: good with suggestions
